Detailed Description

The FileDescriptor returned by gaia::core::Parcel#readFileDescriptor, allowing you to close it when done with it.

The following example demonstrates how to use this ParcelFileDescriptor class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
    gaia::base::String fileName("testParcelFileDescriptor");
    gaia::storage::File* file =
            new gaia::storage::File(String("/data"), fileName);

    gaia::storage::FileOutputStream* fout =
            new gaia::storage::FileOutputStream(file);

    ByteArray blob(4);
    blob[0] = 0x0;
    blob[1] = 0x1;
    blob[2] = 0x2;
    blob[3] = 0x3;
    fout->write(blob);
    fout->close();

    ParcelFileDescriptor* pf = ParcelFileDescriptor::openN(
            file, ParcelFileDescriptor::FDmode::MODE_READ_WRITE);
    int32_t fd = pf->getFd();
    pf->close();
 }

Definition at line 57 of file ParcelFileDescriptor.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::FDmode

The file modes.

Enumerator:
MODE_WORLD_READABLE 

For use with openN: if MODE_CREATE has been supplied and this file doesn't already exist, then create the file with permissions such that any application can read it.

MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE 

For use with openN: if MODE_CREATE has been supplied and this file doesn't already exist, then create the file with permissions such that any application can write it.

MODE_READ_ONLY 

For use with openN: open the file with read-only access.

MODE_WRITE_ONLY 

For use with openN: open the file with write-only access.

MODE_READ_WRITE 

For use with openN: open the file with read and write access.

MODE_CREATE 

For use with openN: create the file if it doesn't already exist.

MODE_TRUNCATE 

For use with openN: erase contents of file when opening.

MODE_APPEND 

For use with openN: append to end of file while writing.

Definition at line 88 of file ParcelFileDescriptor.h.

Member Function Documentation

static ParcelFileDescriptor* gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::adoptFdN ( int32_t  fd) [static]

Take ownership of a raw native fd in to a new ParcelFileDescriptor.

The returned ParcelFileDescriptor now owns the given fd, and will be responsible for closing it. You must not close the fd yourself.

Parameters:
fdThe native fd that the ParcelFileDescriptor should adopt.
Returns:
Returns a new ParcelFileDescriptor holding a FileDescriptor for the given fd.
void gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::close ( )

Close the ParcelFileDescriptor.

This implementation closes the underlying OS resources allocated to represent this stream.

static ParcelFileDescriptor* gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::createFromParcelN ( const gaia::core::Parcel &  source) [static]

Create a new instance of this class, instantiating it from the given Parcel whose data had previously been written by writeToParcel().

static base::Vector<ParcelFileDescriptor*> gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::createPipeN ( ) [static]

Create two ParcelFileDescriptors structured as a data pipe.

The first ParcelFileDescriptor in the returned array is the read side; the second is the write side.

int32_t gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::detachFd ( )

Return the native fd int for this ParcelFileDescriptor and detach it from the object here.

You are now responsible for closing the fd in native code.

static ParcelFileDescriptor* gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::fromFdN ( int32_t  fd) [static]

Create a new ParcelFileDescriptor from a raw native fd.

The new ParcelFileDescriptor holds a dup of the original fd passed in here, so you must still close that fd as well as the new ParcelFileDescriptor.

Parameters:
fdThe native fd that the ParcelFileDescriptor should dup.
Returns:
Returns a new ParcelFileDescriptor holding a FileDescriptor for a dup of the given fd.
int32_t gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::getFd ( )

Return the native fd int for this ParcelFileDescriptor.

The ParcelFileDescriptor still owns the fd, and it still must be closed through this API.

FileDescriptor* gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::getFileDescriptorN ( )

Retrieve the actual FileDescriptor associated with this object.

Returns:
Returns the FileDescriptor associated with this object.
static ParcelFileDescriptor* gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::openN ( const File &  file,
FDmode  mode 
) [static]

Create a new ParcelFileDescriptor accessing a given file.

Parameters:
fileThe file to be opened.
modeThe desired access mode, must be one of MODE_READ_ONLY, MODE_WRITE_ONLY, or MODE_READ_WRITE; may also be any combination of MODE_CREATE, MODE_TRUNCATE, MODE_WORLD_READABLE, and MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE.
Returns:
Returns a new ParcelFileDescriptor pointing to the given file.
ParcelFileDescriptor& gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::operator= ( const ParcelFileDescriptor &  o)

Assignment operator.

void gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::writeToParcel ( gaia::core::Parcel *  out,
int32_t  flags 
)

Flatten this object in to a Parcel.

If PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE is set in flags, the file descriptor will be closed after a copy is written to the Parcel.
